oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SI-SAS. A SAS Code to Calculate Several Selection Indexes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Alvarado, Gregorio
Cerón, Jesús
Crossa, José
Burgueño, Juan
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: SELECTION INDEX
SMITH INDEX
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: SI-SAS is a code written in SAS to produce several selection indexes. To run the code you have to have SAS 9.2 or higher installed in your computer. The first task is to change the folder where the data file to analyze is located and the name of the file. The data file must be in csv format with columns for variables and rows for observations. Two different designs can be analyzed, complete block design and incomplete block design as single or multiple trials. After you made the changes in the code run it and several windows will guide you through the analysis.
oai_dc:dc.dc:citation: Alvarado, Gregorio; Cerón, Jesús; Crossa, José; Burgueño, Juan, 2015-1, "SI-SAS. A SAS Code to Calculate Several Selection Indexes", http://hdl.handle.net/11529/10242 International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center [Distributor] V4 [Version]
